creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The first invocation of 
http://127.0.0.1:8080/examples/jsp/jsptoserv/jsptoservlet.jsp will fail with a 
404.

I added some traces in the JspServlet (adding System.out.println("Serving: " + 
request.getRequestURI()) at the beginning of the method).

On the first invocation the traces are :
Serving: /examples/jsp/jsptoserv/jsptoservlet.jsp
Serving: /examples/servlet/servletToJsp

On all subsequent invocations :
Serving: /examples/jsp/jsptoserv/jsptoservlet.jsp
Serving: /examples/jsp/jsptoserv/hello.jsp

Is this a mapping problem ?

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Yep, it is a bug I am in the middle of working on.  It's caused by an
interaction between the invoker servlet and request dispatching, which was
broken by the recent changes to ApplicationDispatcher to be compliant with the
spec.

Evidence so far says it's not related to the fact that this example uses JSPs
(phew).  I've got a test case that fails on invoker->servlet->invoker that I'm
using to debug.

Worked around by changes to the way that request dispatchers and invokers
interact.  Will be fixed in nightly build 20010720, and in the Tomcat 4.0 beta 6
build to be created today.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
